sentence: The other shows featured members from the select committee on January 6, including Reps. Adam Schiff (D-CA), Liz Cheney (R-WY), and Bennie Thompson (D-MS).
author: Rebecca Downs
title: Sunday Shows Were Hyperfocused on Reminding Everyone About January 6

sentence: pic.twitter.com/LD0nMmJofP The Hill (@thehill) January 2, 2022 x Jan. 6 panel chair says "significant testimony" shows White House "had been told to do something" https://t.co/3yriFIuQDW pic.twitter.com/oFhvo1mQDx The Hill (@thehill) January 2, 2022 REPUBLICAN REP. LIZ CHENEY x .
title: BIDEN---DAY347---Evening

sentence: Vice Chair Liz Cheney, a Wyoming Republican, told ABC News of "firsthand testimony" that Trump's daughter Ivanka, then a West Wing adviser, twice asked him to intervene in a melee in which police officers were beaten by his crowd.
author: Stephen Collinson
title: January 6 committee gets inside Trump's West Wing wall of obstruction

sentence: Committee Vice Chair Liz Cheney, a Wyoming Republican, revealed that there was "firsthand" testimony that Trump's daughter Ivanka, then a White House official, twice asked her father to call off the rioters.
author: Stephen Collinson
title: Call for Pence cooperation shows ambition of January 6 panel ahead of anniversary

sentence: Asked a month ago during a stop in New Hampshire whether he'll cooperate with the committee, Pence told Fox News and The Associated Press that "we'll evaluate any of those requests as they come" Rep. Liz Cheney of Wyoming, a vocal anti-Trump Republican and one of only two GOP representatives on the committee, told NBC News on Thursday: "We look forward to continuing the cooperation that we've had with members of the former vice president's team, and I look forward as well to his cooperation."
author: Paul Steinhauser
title: Former Vice President Pence quiet on one-year mark of Capitol attack

sentence: Riggleman is listed as a sponsor of a fundraiser for Rep. Liz Cheney (R-WY), despite how he works as an advisor for the January 6 select committee, where Cheney serves as vice chair.
author: Rebecca Downs
title: Former Rep. Hosting Fundraiser for Liz Cheney, Even Though He Works for Jan. 6 Select Committee

sentence: This is the third and final column in a three-column series on the House Select January 6 Committee, prompted by the Republican National Committee's censure of Liz Cheney and Adam Kinzinger, the House committee's two GOP members, and Senate minority leader Mitch McConnell's rebuke of the censure resolution.
author: Andrew C. McCarthy
title: Fix the January 6 Committee

sentence: Former President Donald Trump is pushing Wyoming lawmakers to back legislation that would bar Democrats and other non-Republicans from casting ballots in statewide GOP primaries, in a move widely seen as a way to sink Rep. Liz Cheney's prospects for renomination by the party.
author: John L. Dorman
title: Trump wants Wyoming lawmakers to change their election laws to block Liz Cheney from receiving crossover votes in the state's GOP primary

sentence: In a statement following the committee's request to the GOP leader, McCarthy said: As a representative and the leader of the minority party, it is with neither regret nor satisfaction that I have concluded to not participate with this select committee's abuse of power that stains this institution today and will harm it going forward.? McCarthy has dodged questions around Jan. 6 from reporters, even running away from one during an exchange this February in the Capitol after the Republican National Committee agreed to censure the probe's only Republican members: Reps. Liz Cheney and Adam Kinzinger.
title: Who's who: A rolling guide to the targets of the Jan. 6 committee

sentence: Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) took the unprecedented step of rejecting House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy's recommended list of Republican participants, and appointed only two Republicans Reps. Liz Cheney (R-WY) and Adam Kinzinger (R-IL) alongside seven Democrats.
author: Joel B. Pollak
title: Contempt Charge Against Dan Scavino Based on False Claims by January 6 Committee
Jan. 6 committee asks three pro-Trump GOP lawmakers for testimony
